This vignette give a basic understanding of the `citations.network` returned within a list by `codexplor::get_doc_network_from_project`.

##Overview

`codexplor::get_doc_network_from_project` :

1. compute a `corpus.list` as it is returned by `codexplor::construct_corpus` (see [vignette of `construct_corpus`](https://clement-lvd.github.io/codexplor/articles/vignette_construct_corpus.html))
2. and add a new `data.frame` with additional classes `citations.network` and `internal.dependencies`, as the edgelist of a network of the functions defined within the files of the corpus (see the [vignette of the `citations.network` `data.frame`](https://clement-lvd.github.io/codexplor/articles/vignette_citations.network_df_of_internal.dependencies.html)). 

In such a `citations.network` of `internal.dependencies`, links start from the programming file that calls a function and point to the programming file where the function is defined.

### Example
Given folders path(s) and/or github repo(s), compute a *citations network* of the functions with ![.](https://img.shields.io/badge/{Method}-bold?style=flat&logoColor=black&logoSize=2&label=get_doc_network_from_project()&labelColor=yellow&color=black)

```{r construct-corpus-and-network, eval = F, echo=TRUE}
require(codexplor)
net <- get_doc_network_from_project(
  repos =  c("tidyverse/stringr", "clement-lvd/codexplor"))
        # by default, codexplor deal with R project

get_networkd3_from_igraph(net$citations.network)
        # Return an interactive dataviz' from networkD3
```


By default, `get_networkd3_from_igraph` will colorize the nodes accordingly to their indegrees. This reveal the local dependencies of the programming project (i.e. functions used by others files of the project). 

![.](../man/figures/example_net3d_dataviz.png){width=90%}

*(codexplor functions network is truncated)*

For example, the most-common local dependancy inside the tidyverse/stringr repo is `compat-types-check.R`, [...] and we see that one of the `codexplor` file actually rely on a `stringr`method (i.e. `codexplor::str_extract_all_to_tidy_df.R` rely on `stringr/extract.R`). The opposite is not true.

Playing with the parameters will reveal others insights, e.g., you should try to color nodes accordingly to their outdegrees, in order to reveal the high-level files of the project.
